title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the credit percentage for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property to 50 percent. There is no dollar limitation for property related to hydrogen. The credit is also allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, with specific requirements for hydrogen fuel storage or dispensing. The term "specified off-highway vehicles" is defined as all motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding certain equipment like farm tractors and bulldozers. The credit for hydrogen property has been extended through December 31, 2016. The amendments apply to property placed in service after the enactment date for taxable years ending after that date. The repeal of limitation applies to taxable years beginning after the enactment date, and the amendment for hydrogen refueling property applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2014. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50% credit for qualified fuel cell property in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency of 70% or more, and a 40% credit for systems with an energy efficiency of at least 60% but less than 70%. The tax code is amended to limit the credit for qualified fuel cell property based on capacity. Property described in subsection (a)(2)(A)(i) has a credit limit of $2,500 for each 0.5 kilowatt, while property in subsection (a)(2)(A)(ii) has a limit of $2,000 for each 0.5 kilowatt. The tax code is amended to limit the credit for qualified fuel cell property based on capacity. Property in subsection (a)(2)(A)(iii)(I) has a credit limit of $1,500 for each 0.5 kilowatt. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
